related_issues.title: How to change the font of the linux app?
related_issues.text:
How to change the font of the linux app? ### Discussed in https://github.com/pieces-app/support/discussions/600
Originally posted by **rafidahmed816** January 27, 2025 The font is too bold. Can I change the font style? ![Screenshot from 2025-01-27 16-30-12](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fc48f057-36b7-4645-89b8-373702db6fdc)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary **Key points raised:** * User @rafidahmed816 inquired about changing the font within Pieces Copilot chats. **Problems identified:** * Currently, there is no setting to change the font in Pieces Copilot chats. **Solutions proposed/implemented:** * The author suggests exploring the possibility of introducing a setting to change the font. **Current status/outcome:** * The author will document the request on the roadmap for further consideration. **Additional notes:** * The conversation is from January 27, 2025. * It is unclear if the font setting has been implemented since then.

related_issues.title: Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
related_issues.text:
Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I tried to include the Pieces OS endpoint (127.0.0.1:1000) into my external project, but even though Pieces OS is operating, I keep getting the error "Connection refused."

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f50f1e1d-4eb2-46a2-9df7-2892ea6d319b)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Raju-git20 created an issue regarding PiecesOS connectivity.
* mark-at-pieces responded that PiecesOS now uses port 39300, which was not working for Raju-git20.
* Raju-git20 shared screenshots of the error messages.
* mark-at-pieces explained that PiecesOS uses a range of ports and suggested a port-finding algorithm for Raju-git20's project.
* Raju-git20 wanted to discuss their project and receive feedback.

**Problems Identified:**

* Raju-git20 was using an outdated port number for PiecesOS.
* Raju-git20's project encountered connectivity issues with PiecesOS.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* mark-at-pieces suggested using port 39300 and the port-finding algorithm.
* mark-at-pieces offered to connect Raju-git20 with the right people at Pieces for further assistance.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Raju-git20 received information about the new port and port-finding algorithm.
* Raju-git20 expressed interest in scheduling a call for discussion and feedback.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems unresolved as of the last conversation on January 27, 2025.
* Raju-git20's project involves LinkedIn scraping and application using AI.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces OS on Windows.  Problems include outdated port numbers (1000) and "route not found" errors on port 39300.  Solutions involve using the correct port range (39300+) and a port-finding algorithm.  The Pieces team is actively investigating and providing support.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Issue:** ThemePark is unable to open Pieces Core Services on Windows 10.

**Key Points:**

* User reported the issue and received an automatic response with helpful resources.
* Mack-at-pieces, a Pieces team member, investigated further and asked for more information.
* ThemePark responded with their Windows version and confirmed installed software.

**Problems Identified:**

* Unable to open Pieces Core Services on Windows 10.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Troubleshooting and further investigation by Mack-at-pieces.** 
* **No solutions have been implemented yet.**

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* **Open and pending further investigation by Pieces team.**

**Additional Notes:**

* The related issues suggested by the bot and the provided resources might be helpful for troubleshooting.
* This summary only covers the information available in the provided conversation.

recommendations: **Prioritize Pieces OS Connectivity Issues:** Allocate additional resources to investigate and resolve the root causes of Pieces OS connectivity problems on Windows.  This includes addressing outdated port numbers and "route not found" errors.

**Improve Error Messaging:** Provide clearer and more informative error messages to users experiencing connectivity issues.  This will help them troubleshoot problems more effectively and reduce support requests.
**Develop a Troubleshooting Guide:** Create a comprehensive troubleshooting guide for Pieces OS connectivity issues.  Include step-by-step instructions, common error codes, and their solutions.
**Enhance Documentation:** Update documentation to reflect the current port range (39300+) for Pieces OS and provide clear instructions on how to use the port-finding algorithm.
**Consider Font Customization:** Explore the possibility of adding a font customization option to the Pieces desktop app to address user requests for this feature.
**Investigate Non-Dismissable Overlay:** Investigate the root cause of the non-dismissable overlay message and implement a fix to prevent it from recurring.

**Proactive Communication:**  For known issues like the Pieces OS connectivity problems, proactively communicate the issue, workarounds, and expected resolution time to users through release notes, blog posts, or in-app notifications.
